location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Stephen Babington, Secretary to the Government at Bombay Castle, to Lieutenant William Bruce, Resident at Bushire

mods.abstract: Letter from Stephen Babington, Secretary to the Government at Bombay Castle, to Lieutenant William Bruce, Resident at Bushire, acknowledging the receipt of a letter dated 9 September, and informing that the Government is glad to find that the Joasimese [Qasimi] Chief, Shaikh Hassen ben Ramah [Hasan bin Rahma], is keen to observe the Treaties and respect British ships.The letter encloses a letter from C. W. Elwood, Secretary to Government at Porebunder [Porbandar, India] on 17 August 1814 to Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government at Bombay, worried that the Joasimese [Qasimi] Pirates will reappear in the Persian Gulf to attack smaller British ships, avoiding the bigger cruizers and armed vessels.
